Title: Import Source
Description: The system shall import trade data from CapTrader 'Activity Statements' provided in CSV format. The import process must support the 'Complex/Details' mode to ensure all necessary fields are available.

Title: Incremental Updates
Description: The system must be idempotent; when running the import on the same file multiple times, it shall ignore duplicates and not create redundant entries in the output.

Title: Data Persistence
Description: All extracted data must be centrally stored in a trades.xml file, which serves as the 'Single Source of Truth' for downstream analysis.

Title: Dividends
Description: The system shall detect dividend payments within the CSV and store them in a dedicated <Dividends> section in the XML.

Title: Cash Flow
Description: Transactions representing deposits or withdrawals must be identified and stored in a specific section to allow for transparent tracking of capital flows.

Title: Commission Extraction
Description: All transaction fees (commissions) must be extracted from the CSV and stored as a separate <Commission> tag for each trade.

Title: Instrument Metadata
Description: The system shall extract descriptive metadata for each traded instrument, specifically the full Name and a unique Identifier (ID, e.g., ISIN). This data is available in the 'Financial Instrument Information' section of the source CSV.

Title: File Archiving
Description: After a CSV file has been successfully processed and its data has been added, the system must move the source file to an oldcsv directory to prevent re-processing.

Title: Ticker Mapping
Description: The system must be able to normalize historical ticker symbols to their current equivalents (e.g., mapping '4GLD' to 'GLD') to ensure continuity in history.

Title: Semantic XML
Description: The output XML shall be logically grouped (e.g., Meta, Instrument, Execution) to maximize human readability and machine parsing.

Title: Data Completeness
Description: All critical trade fields must be preserved, including Symbol, Date, Quantity, Price, Fees, and Proceeds.

Title: Numeric Format
Description: Numeric values in the XML output must use German notation (comma as the decimal separator) to align with downstream Excel/local tools.

Title: Date Format
Description: Dates shall be formatted as DD.MM.YYYY. The time of execution must be stored separately in HH:MM:SS format.

Title: Identification
Description: The system must generate deterministic IDs (hashes) for every transaction to allow for reliable deduplication and referencing.

Title: Currency
Description: Original currencies must be preserved; no currency conversion should be performed during the import.

Title: Input Map
Description: Optionally, the system shall read a ticker_map.json file to retrieve renaming rules for tickers.

Title: CLI & Auto-Discovery
Description: The tool shall operate as a Command Line Interface (CLI). It should accept a file path as an argument or automatically discover the most recent CSV file in the working directory.

Title: CLI Arguments
Description: The script checks sys.argv. If an argument is provided, it is treated as the target filename.

Title: Auto-Discovery
Description: If no argument is provided, the script scans the directory for *.csv files and selects the one with the most recent modification time.

Title: Section Parsing
Description: The parser iterates through the CSV rows, detecting section headers (e.g., 'Trades', 'Dividends') to switch its parsing logic contextually.

Title: Metadata Parsing
Description: The parser shall identify the section header 'Informationen zum Finanzinstrument'. It will iterate through this section to build a dictionary mapping the 'Symbol' to its 'Beschreibung' (Name) and 'Wertpapier-ID' (ISIN/ID).

Title: Trade Mapping
Description: Specific columns are mapped to object fields. 'Quantity' > 0 denotes a Buy. Commission columns are aggregated.

Title: Dividend Mapping
Description: Parses the Dividend section, extracting amount, currency, and date.

Title: Deposit Mapping
Description: Parses the 'Deposits & Withdrawals' section for cash flow entries.

Title: Archive Processed File
Description: Upon successful processing (if new data was written), the script moves the source CSV file into the ./oldcsv/ directory using os.rename.

Title: Load Map
Description: On startup, the system checks for ticker_map.json. If found, it loads it into a dictionary mapping = {"OLD": "NEW"}.

Title: XML Root
Description: The root element <TradeLog> shall contain children <Trades> and <Dividends>.

Title: Trade Element
Description: Trades are stored as <Trade id="..."> with sub-elements for details.

Title: Div Element
Description: Dividends are stored as <Dividend id="...">.

Title: Dep Element
Description: Cash flows are stored as <Transaction id="...">.

Title: XML Enrichment
Description: During the generation of the <Trade> element, the system looks up the metadata using the symbol. It injects the attributes name="..." and id="..." into the tag.

Title: Num Format
Description: Python floats are converted to strings, replacing periods with commas.

Title: Date Format
Description: Timestamps are split into <Date> (DD.MM.YYYY) and <Time> (HH:MM:SS) tags.

Title: ID-Hash Trade
Description: The Trade ID is generated via MD5 hash of (Date + Symbol + Qty + Gross + Commission).

Title: ID-Hash Div
Description: The Dividend ID is generated via MD5 hash of (Date + Symbol + Amount + Description).

Title: Deduplication
Description: New items are checked against a set of existing IDs to prevent duplicates.

Title: Normalization
Description: Before processing, the Symbol is checked against the mapping dictionary. If a match is found, it is replaced by the new value.
